title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.3 - Residence
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 145-1.3 - Residence

State Regulations
(a) If legal
residence in New York State is established by law as a requirement for an
award, such award shall remain in effect only so long as the holder thereof
continues to maintain such residence, and an award cancelled for failure to
maintain such legal residence shall not be subject to reinstatement. (b) If awards are allocated on a geographic
basis, the candidate shall compete in the geographic subdivision in which the
candidate resides on the date of the examination on which the awards are based, or, if no examination is administered, on the last day on which applications
are accepted. (c) If a minimum
period of residence is established as an eligibility requirement, the student
shall be considered eligible if such requirement is met by the last day of the
month in which the award becomes effective. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
145-1.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
